humanMachineDialogue.author: Memory Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: Based on the pathology report, one out of the two sentinel lymph nodes is positive for metastatic carcinoma (Rule 1, Rule 8, New Rule 10, New Rule 11, and New Rule 12). The largest metastatic focus in sentinel lymph node #1 is 0.4 cm (Rule 12). Therefore, the N stage for this patient is N1.

humanMachineDialogue.author: ZS Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The N stage for a cancer patient is determined by the presence and extent of cancer involvement in the lymph nodes. In this pathology report, it is stated that 'ONE OF TWO SENTINEL LYMPH NODES POSITIVE FOR METASTATIC CARCINOMA' (D and E). More specifically, Sentinel Lymph Node #1 has a largest metastatic focus of 0.4 cm (Part D). Therefore, the N stage for this patient is N1, as there is cancer found in one to three axillary lymph nodes, and the largest metastasis is less than 3 cm.
